title: Downton Abbey’s Joanne Froggatt and Lily James at the Golden Globes 2016
title_page: Downton Abbey’s Joanne Froggatt and Lily James at the Golden Globes 2016 | Daily Mail Online
text:
She propelled to stardom after playing the endearing Lady’s maid Anna Bates in hit period drama Downton Abbey.
And on Sunday evening, Joanne Froggatt looked absolutely sensational as she floated across the red carpet alongside co-star Lily James at the 73rd Annual Golden Globe Awards, held at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles
The British beauty, who is nominated for Best Performance by an Actress in a Limited Series or Motion Picture Made for Television, turned heads in a daring periwinkle blue Reem Acra dress.
Scroll down for video
British sweethearts: Joanne Froggatt (left) looked sensational at theGolden Globe Awards, held at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles on Sunday while Downton co-star Lily James cut an ethereal figure (right)
The plunging strapless gown, which featured a heart-shaped bodice and a cinched waist, was teamed with a pair of striking Chopard pink diamond earrings, worth a staggering $1million.
With her honey coloured tresses swept into a centre parting, her pretty facial features were enhanced with subtle tones of makeup.
The blonde beauty, 35, has been nominated for the prestigious award for role as Anna Bates in the ITV drama - she picked up the gong last year for her work in the same role.

Winning look: Joanne, who is nominated for Best Performance by an Actress in a Limited Series or Motion Picture Made for Television, turned heads in a daring periwinkle blue Reem Acra dress
Speaking exclusively to The Daily Mail ahead of the event, Joanne admitted that she had now moved to America with her husband, James Cannon, to pursue opportunities in Hollywood.
‘We’ve taken the plunge and done it. Last Tuesday we rented out our house for six months, boarded a flight to Los Angeles and here we are,’ she said. ‘We’re actually homeless. We’re living in a hotel until we can find ourselves somewhere to rent out here. We have some feelers out and we’re assembling a list of places to view.
‘I have no jobs lined up in Hollywood but there are so many opportunities to be had. We’re going to have a little bit of a break first and then plunge right in and see what’s out there. I won’t be here forever. My home is in England. I just want to see what happens.’
Elsewhere, Lily – who is best known for her role as Lady Rose in the beloved show – oozed heaps of elegance in her angelic white gown.

With her golden-tinted tresses left in tousled waves, the 26-year-old looked nothing short of glamorous in her style choice.
The talented star appeared to be in fantastic spirits as bumped into award-winning actress Cate Blanchett on the arrivals carpet.
Meanwhile, the awards are an accolade bestowed by 93 member of the Hollywood Foreign Press Association for film and television, both in foreign and domestic markets.
It has been held at the Beverly Hilton Hotel since 1961, and will be broadcast live on NBC this coming year from the same location on January 10, 2016.
The Golden Globes often rank as the third most watched awards show each year, just behind the Oscars and the Grammys.
